item.title: VIM: Handle Urls
item.description: Making a shortcut to open urls under cursor Note: There is also available gx shortcut that uses netrw plugin. But I’ve decided to use own little solution instead of big plugin for one function. """ open urls using \u shortcut function HandleURL() let l:uri = matchstr(getline("."), '[a-z]*:\/\/[^ >,;)]*') if l:uri != "" silent call system("xdg-open " . shellescape(l:uri, 1)) else echo "No URI found in line." endif endfunction nnoremap <leader>u :call HandleURL()<cr> """ Now if we hit \u shortcut while our cursor is on the url line, this url will be opened in default browser.
